timeline.bodyText: So if the hfile.endKey > region.endKey, we don't always split the file by region.endKey anymore? Can you explain what should be the ideal split point in this case?
timeline.author: wchevreuil

replies.bodyText: yes，if hfile span multi regions, for example A,B,C,D,E,F(the start key of these regions are in ascending order), we should use region C endkey to split, not region A. In this way, we can get equal .top and .bottom hfiles, reduce time complexity of split from O(n) to O(logn),decrease invoke of bulkLoad rpc to regionserver ,and also avoid write amplification during copyHFileHalf
